# RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle

**Enumeration**

A type that represents the style to use when formatting the units of relative dates.

## Declaration

```swift
enum UnitsStyle
```

## Formatting Date and Time Units

- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle.abbreviated**: A style that uses abbreviated units, such as “2 mo. ago”.
- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle.full**: A style that uses full units, such as “2 months ago”.
- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle.short**: A style that uses shortened units, such as “2 mo. ago”.
- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle.spellOut**: A style that spells out units such as “two months ago”.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Configuring Formatter Options

- **calendar**: The calendar to use for formatting values that don’t have an inherent calendar of their own.
- **locale**: The locale to use when formatting the date.
- **dateTimeStyle**: The style to use when describing a relative date, for example “yesterday” or “1 day ago”.
- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.DateTimeStyle**: A type that represents the style to use when formatting relative dates, such as “1 week ago” or “last week”.
- **unitsStyle**: The style to use when formatting the quantity or the name of the unit, such as “1 day ago” or “one day ago”.
- **formattingContext**: A description of where the formatted string will appear, allowing the formatter to capitalize the output appropriately.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
